name: The Landmark Mandarin Oriental, Hong Kong

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So many others before me have attested in great detail to the beautiful atmosphere and extraordinary service at the Landmark Mandarin Oriental that I cannot do much more than add my wholehearted accord to the deservedly glowing reviews. Our very first moments promised an incredible week-long stay. Eva, the kind and ultra-professional front desk agent, efficiently checked us in and then showed us to our room, going through the many amenities with us – a delightful arrangement I had never experienced before. My room, the smaller of the two types available, was large, comfortable and amazingly outfitted with the latest in technology. I was happy to find a leather box with all the cables I would need to connect my laptop to the internet and my ipod to the fully-integrated entertainment system. The large, wall-mounted flat screen-tv served as the interface for all the entertainment components and was a delight to watch.
reviews.title: An Amazing New Year's Eve at the LMO!

likes.liked: — The outstanding service and modern amenities

reviews.text: The bathroom was sleek, modern and stocked with every amenity available, from toothbrushes and toothpaste to deodorant and q-tips; perfect for forgetful packers like myself.
reviews.title: Heaven on earth with style.
Loved the technology
reviews.text: The staff was some of the best I’ve experienced anywhere. Each was welcoming, friendly, and managed to be casual in conversation while at all times respectful and service-oriented.

reviews.text: We dined at Amber on New Year’s Eve and could not have been more pleased with the experience. A James Bond/Casino Royale theme was well played out and everyone had a fantastic time. In a room full of revelers, we received remarkably individualized service throughout our delicious nine-course meal and rang-in 2007 in an unforgettable celebration with guests and staff. The next morning, Amber had been completely restored to a calming environment where we enjoyed a wonderful breakfast.
reviews.title: A perfect 10

likes.liked: — Fantastic room, great spa, excellent staff

reviews.text: The Landmark Mandarin Oriental brings the legendary level of comfort set by her older sister to a new generation of travelers, and played an integral part in making our New Year’s trip to Hong Kong one of the best in recent memory. We enthusiastically recommend it to all within earshot, and cannot wait to go back. Enjoy your high tea at the Peninsula, but stay at the LMO!

reviews.text: Comparison: Besides the MO Landmark, I also stayed at the Four Seasons and the Island Shangri-La in the past. Rooms at MO Landmark are the most spacious and the services are the most personable. Four Seasons, situated at the waterfront, has the best harbor view and located next to the expensive IFC shopping mall and is above the airport express train. IFC mall is great for window shopping but is so overpriced; for example, clothes in the Brooks Brothers cost three times more than the US’s. The most impressive about the Island Shangri-La is the 17-story atrium featuring the world’s largest 16-story high Chinese silk painting. Although the MO Landmark and FS are both top-notched hotels and MO’s rooms and services are slightly better, I prefer the FS purely for its harbor view.
reviews.title: Mixed Feelings.....

reviews.text: This hotel is what Hong Kong is all about-service. Clean, cool, modern rooms that you can find anywhere in the town but the level of professionalism from the staff is amazing and what makes Landmark special.

reviews.text: We just stayed at the this property for three days. The service was Impecable, from the spa staff, to the front desk and concierge. The front desk also sent us a bottle of Vueve clicot champagne when they found out we were on our honeymoon. We stayed in a L600 premiere room on the top floor, corner room. The rooms are extremely high tech and work really well the bathroom is amazing, the huge bathtub is wonderful. In addition the robes are super comfortable. They also provide a bathroom drawer with all necessities include hand sanitizer. The beds are comfortable and it was quiet throughout the night which was. Ery surprising in such a busy city. The spa is heaven, my only complaint is the jacuzzi was cold. However all spa amenities are amazing. The decor and service is exceptional. I highly recommend this property. The location is perfect, close to all the best shopping. I am very impressed by this hotel and highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Beautiful Rooms, Perfect Location but Some Issues

reviews.text: This hotel is not like othr mandarin orientals. the crowed is more western and not so much asian. We had a suite and it was amazing. very specius with one bedroom seperate living room and a huge bathroom with a nice jakuzzi in the middel. Of corsoue the price was not low but you get what you pay. Its right next t the MTR Central Station and in the hotel you have shopping arcades. Stuff is friendly and the hotel is very very clean. you can walk to everywhere in a few minutes and the can organize you everything what you want. Definetly a nice hotel in the heart of Hong Kong Island

reviews.text: I loved the Landmark MO spacious rooms , as we are a family travellign with 2 kids.The location of the hotel is convenient located next to the designer Landmark mall.Since the hotel doesnt have alot of restaurants to choose from .There is an array of restaurants to choose frm in the adjacent malls(zuma,nice french cafes etc).But it was abit trying to shop while pushing my toddler in the trolley,as there are many steps connecting the malls together,you must map out where are the elevators , and in which building.But shopping was a blast!!!!
reviews.title: Spacious Rooms...comfortable stay

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Landmark Mandarin Oriental a few times, and I believe it is the only truly impressive spa/boutique hotel in Hong Kong. The rooms are truly spacious and everything from the soap to the bed forces you to relax. The spa is the gem at the center of what makes this hotel truly special -- in addition to the various treatment options for a fee, there are also "aqua experiences" that are free for the guests to use.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel for Leisure Travelers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some travelers have complained that the hotel is located close to other office buildings, which is not entirely unfounded. However, unless you stay in Kowloon, it is simply a fact of life that the buildings in Central Hong Kong are extremely concentrated. (By the way, the Four Seasons does offer better views in Central Hong Kong, but be forewarned that the hotel is about a 10 minute walk to the heard of Central.)
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel. Outstanding Service. Friendly Staffs. Very Helpful at all times
Not what I was expecting from a Mandarin Hotel
reviews.text: The service is extremely friendly, and like any Mandarin Oriental, they go beyond the call of duty to see to it that you are comforable. With that said, I think that the pace and level of the service may leave business travelers frustrated. Although the service is superb on many levels, there are some times when it is spotty, particularly the concierge and bell services. One time, the bell service brought up five dfferent sets of bags before correctly identifying and sendig up my bags. In addition, I have found that the attention to detail that is evident at its sister property (the "old" Mandarin Oriental) is notably absent from the Landmark, and I get the distinct impression that the hotel is used as a "training ground" for staff at the "old" Mandarin Oriental.

Stayed a couple of nights in early May. It is definitely worth pre-booking the hotel limo and greeting service. Our bags were ready to go whilst we waited in the immigration line, and we were then escorted to the limo suite at the airport to pick up our car. The room was extremely well equipped, and whilst the view wasn't great (other large buildings), the location was perfect for shopping at the Landmark Centre, and access to the MRT and Star Ferry was easy. The MO Bar is a cool place to hang out, and the snacks and cocktails were spot on. Overall the service was very good indeed. Try dinner at Man Wah (upscale Chinese) in the sister Oriental hotel - it was great. Will definitely stay here again...as soon as possible please.
reviews.title: Modern chic

reviews.text: Extraordinary service, decor and food. Not one single complaint. Current favorite hotel anywhere in the world.

Very spacious, tasteful decor, big comfy bed, separate sofa & work area with fruit, refreshments & chocs left daily, 3 tv's including one in the bathroom. Amazing walk in shower plus a 2 person tub ! Room has some of the most modern gadgets I've ever come across, great fun. Hotel has excellent spa & pool and even though we did not use, the bar and restaurants looked very nice also. The service & staff are great especially the concierge who are very knowledgeable. Would definately go back.
reviews.title: Pure excellence

reviews.text: First, to make it clear, Landmark MO is a great hotel. However, when compared to the Four Seasons, I think it's just not as good. Stayed at both hotels on recent business trips and here is my take comparing the two
reviews.title: Great but not the best

reviews.text: 1) Location - probably the best part about the landmark MO. A few blocks from LKF makes it convenient for late night partying. Four Seasons is not horrible but it is just a bit more walk to LKF (I usually take a cab in summer given how hot it is)
reviews.title: Outstanding stay!

reviews.text: 2) Room - the L450 room at MO, despite being quoted just a little smaller than the standard room at the Four Seasons, feels a lot smaller. I think the layout of the room probably is the reason it feels smaller. Not a lot of space next to the two sinks due to having the bathroom door between them. Meanwhile, the Four Seasons room and the bathroom feel a lot more spacious. MO has speakers wired into the ceilings so it's pretty cool for TV/ DVD/ Music. I think FS has slightly nicer furnitures (we are talking about both being high end so it's not like MO's furnitures are crappy)

reviews.text: I had booked the Meet & Greet service with car transfer to the hotel, and what a delight this was. From the moment I stepped off the plane I was treated like royalty, escorted through immigration and customs, to the waiting Mercedes with water, towels and candy available. On arrival at the hotel, I was greeted and immediately escorted up to my room where the check in was done -- no stop at reception! The luggage arrived instantaneously and I was soon settled in my luxurious accommodation. I had booked the smallest room, L450, but it was more than adequate for my needs -- spacious and comfortable. I had requested a high floor, away from the elevator, and I got exactly that. There was a plate of snacks to welcome me.
reviews.title: Exceptional service!

reviews.text: Once unpacked, I went down to the concierge who could not have been more helpful in giving me advice and directions, and making bookings for me. The bed was beautifully comfortable and after the long flight from Chicago, I slept like a baby.
reviews.title: One of the best in Hong Kong

reviews.text: Breakfast was included in my rate, and the staff at Amber were wonderful; food excellent. I made use of the spa on my last morning for a pedicure -- without a doubt the best pedi I have ever had in my entire life. They use the Bastien Gonzalez technique and although this was advertised as lasting 60 minutes, it was a full 90 minutes of sheer bliss. I would almost think of flying back to Hong Kong just for a repeat!
reviews.title: Absolutely amazing provided you don't need a view

reviews.text: My only quibbles: Charging extra for internet seems a bit unnecessary when one is paying the already steep rates that the LMO charges. Also, since my pedi lasted 30 minutes longer that I had anticipated, I asked if I could check out 15 minutes later than 12 noon, and instead of being gracious about this, I had a call from the front desk asking me to hurry as they were fully booked and needed to service the room. Fifteen minutes was all I had asked! That left a somewhat bad taste in my mouth after an otherwise flawless stay.

reviews.text: You know you're in for something good when this is how it all starts: Long international flight to Hong Kong. You get off the plane and are pleasantly surprised to see a guy at the end of the ramp holding a sign with your name. He takes your bag, puts you on a buggy, whisks you past the throngs at Hong Kong airport and you're the first in line at immigration. He's waiting for you after immigration, helps you with you bag, gets your airport express train ticket and gets you settled on the train to Hong Kong station. Airport meet and greet is a complimentary service provided by the Landmark Mandarin. Granted they get you with the room rate but still this is a great service and plenty of 5 star hotels will nickel and dime you at every turn despite exorbitant room rates.
reviews.title: Awesome service, we started missing it soon as we left

reviews.text: I stayed at the Landmark Mandarin Oriental after reading the many positive reviews on TripAdvisor. Needless to say, the location of this hotel is faultless, especially if you are visiting HK to shop and eat to your hearts content. It is right at the very heart of the shopping areas in Central District, HK and also within walking distance to the Soho area, Lan Kwai Fung and Admiralty.

reviews.text: The hotel has an excellent restaurant restaurant called Amber. The food is divine, though very very expensive. Its apparently a Michelin 2 star restaurant. Serves very creative modern western cuisine.

I paid $600 and something Canadian dollars for the room and I thought that the room was not worth the price. The room had like dust everywhere, corners of windows, ect (I posted a photo. The picture was not the only one I took.). The service was bad, check in time was at like 2 pm (too late). We told the front office manager that we weren't able to sleep because of the noise of the room and he didn't admit that it was the hotel's fault. When we checked out, we said "hi" to the front desk person and she didn't even reply to us and she only checked out for us.

reviews.text: (I didn't go to the resturant or the spa so I couldn't rate them)

reviews.text: Before I checked in to the room for 3 nights, I booked a room at Shangri-La for 4 nights. (Shangri-La is cheaper, almost half the price of this hotel. $400 something Canadian dollars.) And I realized that the room at Shangri-La is actually cleaner, had less noise, had better front desk (was nicer), earlier check-in, and obviously charged us less for the room.
reviews.title: Great City Hotel

reviews.text: I booked the room for my mother, who came to HK to visit. When I did the on-line booking, from the reservation system I could choose some preferences provided by the system, one of which was late check-out. Since my mother came to HK for business, I chose this option. When we checked in, the front staff, who was polite and friendly, gave us a room which was not the higher floor I indicated when I was making the reservation because the higher floor was not ready yet. Fine. We entered the room and everything was like what the photos show from other reviewers. Since my mother had a business dinner, we asked the concierge desk to recommend a quiet restaurant that we could discuss business. We loved the restaurant very much, even my mother's guest, who is a Hong Kong local, praised highly of this restaurant.
reviews.title: convenient, accomodating and upscale business lodging

reviews.text: The problem came the next morning, when I called to ask for the late check out. Whoever the lady was answering the phone was firm not offering the late check out. I mentioned that I already indicated this option when I made the reservation and the front desk staff said nothing at all when we were checking in. Still, the staff only allowed us to stay until 1 pm. Considering my mother's meetings till late afternoon, I continued asking for more time and told them I was not happy that the message was not properly conveyed at checking in. The staff insisted that the room was already assigned to the next guest and we could not have late check out. I really got upset because of the hotel staff's careless conduct that hotel guests had to bear the consequences. Finally, the staff mentioned if I made the booking via American Express, I could enjoy late check out. Yes, I do have the American Express platinum card, but I was not informed this benefit by the hotel earlier. So, yes, no late check out. After several back and forth complaining and discussions, the staff "graciously" extended another 30 minutes of the stay. My poor mother already had enough listening to the discussion between the hotel staff and me. She decided to just check out at 1:30 pm and found elsewhere for her luggage -- not even bother to store her luggage in the hotel.
reviews.title: My NO.1 hotel in HK

reviews.text: The Landmark and its staff are absolute perfection. They have a complementary service where they greet you as soon as you get off the plane and zoom you through the airport. It is very useful if you arrive at 11pm like I did.

The very professional and friendly receptionist recognized me from a previous visit, offered me the use of the spa facilities to get changed and freshen up. She also arranged for a complimentary breakfast at the exquisite hotel bar restaurant on ground level. I used and enjoyed both, then went to work and returned later in the day.

As the room was not ready so soon, I was then whisked to the spa for a complimentary shower and freshen up as well as offered a complimentary breakfast. Upon arrival Heidi offered the latest specials on suits available, but this was out of our price range at double the nightly rate, to include wi-fi, breakfast, spa treatments and larger suit.
